results.abstract: Elvis Mitchell reviews Pixar computer-animated film Monsters, Inc, directed by Peter Docter; photo (M)

headline.main: Monsters of Childhood With Feelings and Agendas

results.snippet: Freaks, mutants and misshapen creatures shambling off to work -- no, it's not a documentary about rush hour on the New York subway system. This is the premise of Pixar's newest brightly colored, computer-animated feature, ''Monsters, Inc.''    Pixar...
results.lead_paragraph: Freaks, mutants and misshapen creatures shambling off to work -- no, it's not a documentary about rush hour on the New York subway system. This is the premise of Pixar's newest brightly colored, computer-animated feature, ''Monsters, Inc.'' Pixar Animation Studios has now so streamlined the process that you may find yourself eagerly awaiting the release of ''Monsters'' on video so you can take in all the myriad visual jokes planted all over the frame, a form of visual invention that adds an extra tickle to the picture. Not that ''Monsters'' needs it; in a final reversal of events, Pixar has given Disney, which financed the film, the last leg up by stealing the style and speed of Warner Brothers cartoons, which used to ridicule Disney's do-gooder ethos.

results.abstract: Brief biographical profiles of some of those lost in Sept 11 terrorist attack: father-and-son firefighters Joseph J Angelini and Joseph J Angelini Jr, Lorisa Taylor, James E Potorti, Joseph R Riverso, Douglas C Miller, Maria Theresa Santillan, Andrew J Bailey, Jonathan Uman, Ronald Comer, James Parham, Sean Canavan, Philip Guza, John Collins, Robert J Mayo; photos (M)

headline.kicker: A NATION CHALLENGED: PORTRAITS OF GRIEF: THE VICTIMS
headline.main: Father-and-Son Firefighters, an Avid Dancer and a Love Sealed in Paris

results.snippet: Here are glimpses of some of the victims of the Sept. 11 attack on the World Trade Center.    JOSEPH J. ANGELINI  JOSEPH J. ANGELINI JR.  The Veteran and His Son      He would not have wanted it any other way.    Joseph J. Angelini Sr. and his son,...

byline.original: These sketches were written by David Barstow, Nichole M. Christian, Adam Clymer, Jan Hoffman, Lynette Holloway, Mary Jo Murphy, Mia Navarro, Andy Newman, Janny Scott and Yilu Zhao

results.lead_paragraph: Here are glimpses of some of the victims of the Sept. 11 attack on the World Trade Center. JOSEPH J. ANGELINI JOSEPH J. ANGELINI JR. The Veteran and His Son He would not have wanted it any other way. Joseph J. Angelini Sr. and his son, Joseph Jr., were firefighters, and neither survived the twin towers' collapse. ''If he had lived and his son had died, I don't think he would have survived,'' said Alfred Benjamin, a firefighter at Rescue Company 1 in Manhattan who was partnered with Mr. Angelini for the last six months.

results.abstract: Stuart Klawans compares Stanley Kubrick and Arthur C Clarke's book 2001: A Space Odyssey and subsequent film with reality of today's International Space Station in light of reissue of film on DVD and in theaters; photos (M)
results.snippet: THE year was 1970, the hour was late, and the dark-bearded young man in the college bookstore had fixed his pupils, the size and color of two double espressos, on a new paperback, ''The Making of Kubrick's '2001.' '' Everything about its pictures --...
results.lead_paragraph: THE year was 1970, the hour was late, and the dark-bearded young man in the college bookstore had fixed his pupils, the size and color of two double espressos, on a new paperback, ''The Making of Kubrick's '2001.' '' Everything about its pictures -- the text was beyond him for the moment -- seemed both wondrous and reasonable to my fellow youth-culturist, whose voice had caught my attention from four aisles away. ''Yes,'' he was saying, ''right,'' he said, ''a space station, right, of course, they'll have a space station, they'll have a space station by 2001.'' His tone was admirably calm for someone who was raving. I thought of this matter-of-fact prophet only recently, because now that it's 2001, we do have an International Space Station, and few people seem to care. In April, the station's crew coped with a critical computer breakdown -- the sort of danger that Stanley Kubrick and his co-author, Arthur C. Clarke, had predicted in ''2001: A Space Odyssey'' -- and did so without distracting America from the start of the baseball season. In July, the mission team installed an elaborate new air lock, and again the public yawned, although not even ''2001'' had foreseen that such orbital tinkering might be performed by a Col. Susan J. Helms.

headline.main: Taliban's Out-of-the-Box Thinker Practiced Crude Science in Kabul

results.snippet: The man who left behind notes, drawings and technical reference books in a two-story private house in Kabul was probably someone with at most an undergraduate education in chemistry and physics who knew how to cook up crude explosives.    The man...

byline.original: By JAMES GLANZ with DAVID ROHDE

results.lead_paragraph: The man who left behind notes, drawings and technical reference books in a two-story private house in Kabul was probably someone with at most an undergraduate education in chemistry and physics who knew how to cook up crude explosives. The man also had a taste for designing hopelessly futuristic weaponry and little understanding of the practical difficulties that would be involved in building it.

results.abstract: Dennis Meredith letter recalls his own delightful encounter with physicist Richard Feynman (Nov 13 comment)
results.snippet: To the Editor:    ''On Stage, a Day in the Life of an Idiosyncratic Physicist'' (Nov. 13) about Alan Alda's portrayal of Richard Feynman brought back memories of my own delightful encounters with Feynman when I directed Caltech's news bureau in the...
results.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: ''On Stage, a Day in the Life of an Idiosyncratic Physicist'' (Nov. 13) about Alan Alda's portrayal of Richard Feynman brought back memories of my own delightful encounters with Feynman when I directed Caltech's news bureau in the 80's.

results.abstract: Yamato Journal on popularity of Aibo robot toy dogs in Japan, where artificial companionship is taken for granted; photo of young hospital patient playing with Aibo dog, which are actually most popular among lonely elderly people; map (M)

headline.main: Yamato Journal; Rover's Just a Robot, but a Great Pal for All That

results.snippet: While several other children whipped up a commotion in a hospital playroom here, one lone boy lingered in the entrance, too shy or too frightened to take off his shoes and enter the fray.    That is until a hospital volunteer, a student from a nearby...
results.lead_paragraph: While several other children whipped up a commotion in a hospital playroom here, one lone boy lingered in the entrance, too shy or too frightened to take off his shoes and enter the fray. That is until a hospital volunteer, a student from a nearby university, beseeched one of several puppies playing on the wooden floor to raise its paw: ''Paw, Aibo. Paw.'' The dog raised a foot, and with that the boy's shoes were off and he quickly lost himself in play.

results.abstract: New Children's Hospital at Montefiore Medical Center in Bronx has bedside computers that will provide 2,000 Web sites to patients, who are often from deprived homes, giving them greater sense of world's possibilities; Dr Irwin Redlener, president, says emphasis on technology and education has benefits for hospital as well as patients; photos (M)

headline.main: In the Bronx, an Ounce of Connection

results.snippet: ENTERING the lobby of the new Children's Hospital at Montefiore Medical Center in the Bronx, one can hardly tell it's a hospital, at least not a hospital in this century.     The reception desk has a pock-marked, sand-colored surface that resembles...
results.lead_paragraph: ENTERING the lobby of the new Children's Hospital at Montefiore Medical Center in the Bronx, one can hardly tell it's a hospital, at least not a hospital in this century. The reception desk has a pock-marked, sand-colored surface that resembles the surface of Venus. On the wall is a giant mural of the Milky Way, with a tiny red dot on Earth saying ''You are here.''

results.abstract: National Aeronautics and Space Administration delays launch of space shuttle Endeavour for at least day because of problem involving docking of Russian cargo spacecraft at International Space Station (M)

headline.main: Space Station Problem Stalls Shuttle Liftoff

results.snippet: The launching of the space shuttle Endeavour was delayed this morning for at least a day because of a problem at its destination, the International Space Station.    Officials at the National Aeronautics and Space Administration said they wanted to...
results.lead_paragraph: The launching of the space shuttle Endeavour was delayed this morning for at least a day because of a problem at its destination, the International Space Station. Officials at the National Aeronautics and Space Administration said they wanted to be sure that the shuttle and its crew of seven could safely dock with the space station even as the problem -- involving the docking of a Russian cargo spacecraft that arrived on Wednesday -- was being resolved.
